fields.physical_description:
Turcoman carpet.

WARP mostly white and brown wool; Z2S; 14 threads per inch (52 per dm).

WEFT: brown wool in lower half and brown and dark brown in upper half; Z2S; 2 shoots after each row of knots (one of each colour in upper half); 7 knots per inch (30 per dm).

PILE: wool: 8 colours: dark red, red, light red, dark green (replaces dark blue in upper part), dark blue, brown, very light brown, white; asymmetrical knot open to the left and tied around 2 threads; 49 knots per sq. inch (780 per sq. dm).

SIDE FINISH: one cord oversewn with dark red wool.

END FINISH: lOWER: maximum 24.5 cms. of plain weave in red weft with narrow bands of dark blue, light blue, white and very light brown.  Upper: maximum 21 cms of plain weave in red weft with narrow bands of blue, white and orange.

DESIGN: Field: red ground with 5 1/2 bands of 4 main guls.  They are polygonal framing a cross that meets in a central rectangle.  Within the rectangle is a cross, horned on both sides on a red or dark red ground.  The crosses are dark blue and white, with one exception.  The four quarters of the gul are light red and blue or light red and white with 3 buds on a single stalk growing out of the central rectangle.  The gul outline is a sequence of brown, red, dark blue and brown.  Offset between the guls are bands of diamonds totally filled with 9 flowerheads in all colours except brown.  Along both sides at the edge of the field is a border with a red and dark red ground on which are dark blue and light red Y-shapes on the diagonal divided by 3 white florets and a white double x-motif.

Main border: red ground with a central line on which are small stepped lozenges; along the left hand side both line and lozenges are in a sequence of 3 blue or green and 1 brown; on the right hand side and the top and bottom the colours tend to alternate.  To either side of the central line there are outwardly facing pairs of stepped Y-motifs, principally in dark blue, white and very light brown with some in green.

Inner and outer borders: brown ground with rosettes in dark red, red, light red, blue and white with contrasting centres.

Outermost border: reciprocal triangles in brown and very light brown outlined in red.
fields.dimensions: Length: 261 cm maximum, Length: 247 cm minimum, Width: 188 cm maximum, Width: 183 cm minimum, Weight: 31 kg
fields.production_note:
Turcoman carpet

mentioned "Turkoman Rugs in the V & A" by R Pinner and M. Franses (intro by Donald King), analyses by L. Pinner.  Hali 1980, Vo;2., No. 4, p. 302, 314, 315.


Low knot counts precludes comparison by design.  For a similar knot count, Gombos (1975) gives a Kizil Ayak origin but his example (no. 27) is in no other way comparable.

See. IS. 960.1883
